author: Joe Patrice
title: DISCO Takes Cecilia AI Platform to EU and UK
text:
DISCO Takes Cecilia AI Platform to EU and UK
Europe has proven more cautious about AI, but legal tech providers are meeting the regulatory challenge.
In a move extending generative AI‚Äôs global reach in the legal industry, DISCO announced the launch of its Cecilia AI Platform across the European Union and the UK. Note how we said, ‚ÄúEuropean Union and the UK‚Äù as opposed to just ‚ÄúEuropean Union‚Äù there? The UK blew up its whole economy just so we have to append its name separately! Brilliant trade-off.
Alas, Cecilia AI promises to streamline the data-heavy lift of modern document review and ediscovery, aiming to turn days and weeks of discovery work into hours.
Getting AI into the hands of the European market requires navigating Europe‚Äôs complex regulatory environment. The EU‚Äôs Artificial Intelligence Act erected a framework to address the risks and ethical concerns posed by AI, introducing stringent requirements on transparency, accountability, and the ability to explain AI decisions. Satisfying Europe‚Äôs call for visibility in AI decision making involves a little extra work than in the U.S., but in addition to the products launched this week, DISCO expects to have more generative AI tools in that market in 2025.
With this launch, DISCO introduces Cecilia Q&A to the European market. This AI fact expert is fully integrated within a user‚Äôs DISCO Ediscovery database. Lawyers can interrogate their document sets directly, receiving quick, citation-backed answers that highlight key documents swimming within the terabytes of data. It‚Äôs a tool designed to put eyes on the most important documents quickly and efficiently. Or, if the attorney wants, there‚Äôs a single-document version of Q&A that limits the interrogation to one item. All of which is done without sourcing source information from online, with answers limited to the information within a customer‚Äôs specific database.
Basically keeping AI from hallucinating by cutting off access to the internet shrooms.
And the document summary function creates the reader‚Äôs digest version of lengthy, complex or important documents to speed up the all-too-familiar process of slogging through a long document only to realize it‚Äôs totally irrelevant.
Which gets back to the theme I took away from my ILTACON meeting with DISCO ‚Äî generative AI‚Äôs most powerful application might just be its appeal as an interface. Legal tech has had the power to deliver a lot of these insights for a while. Providing material relevant to a query or generating a ‚ÄòKey Word In Context‚Äô style summary existed before. But now, AI‚Äôs ability to offer a natural, conversational interface ‚Äî delivering coherent, easily reviewed results ‚Äî makes a difference.
But something about generative AI products have proven more accessible to the lawyerly mind. Personally, I think it‚Äôs the iterative nature of the interface. Prior technology could only answer the most recent query and left it to the user to figure out if their prompt delivered the right result. Hunting and pecking but with inquiries. Generative AI learns from its interactions with the user mimicking the back-and-forth between a partner and associate and improving the results incrementally. This dynamic interface feels more intuitive to lawyers, who are used to a process of refining insights through dialogue.
And occasionally yelling.
Whatever it is, studies reveal that these AI tools have brought many senior attorneys to technology for the first time when they would historically farm that work out to juniors or outside providers. It will be interesting to see if the European and UK contingent follow their American counterparts in embracing this tech.
Because technology is only useful if it gets used.
Joe Patrice is a senior editor at Above the Law and co-host of Thinking Like A Lawyer. Feel free to [email](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#42282d27322336302b21270223202d3427362a272e23356c212d2f) any tips, questions, or comments. Follow him on Twitter or Bluesky if you‚Äôre interested in law, politics, and a healthy dose of college sports news. Joe also serves as a Managing Director at RPN Executive Search.

author: Mary Manley
title: California Coastline to Experience Monstrous Waves This Week
text: California Coast Put on Alert for 'Tremendous' Waves That Could Reach Up to 40 Feet The first huge swell of the winter has arrived in California, and with it comes dangerous surf set to rival some of the biggest waves this year.‚Äî San Francisco Chronicle (@sfchronicle) Read more: [https://t.co/BGPPPsd8Bz] üé•: [@stephenlamphoto] üé• [pic.twitter.com/raSntIcDJ0] [December 28, 2023] [Nicole Sarment](https://www.sfchronicle.com/weather/article/california-surf-wave-warning-18575570.php), a weather service meteorologist. ‚ÄúPeople should really not even go.‚Äù A coastal Flood Warning is in effect for southern California until 3 pm! Beware of potential flooding, high tides, and strong winds along the coast due to large waves. Stay safe!‚Äî WeatherNation (@WeatherNation) [#CoastalFloodWarning] [#CAwx] [pic.twitter.com/gt1rbANJ5c] [December 28, 2023] At least three factors help to create these dramatic wave heights: wind speed, fetch, and time. Fetch being the area over the ocean where winds blow and generate waves, says the weather service. The longer the weather system sits there, the higher the waves will be. These type of weather systems are also more common during the winter months. High tides, big waves and rip currents are on tap for Southern California‚Äî Jon Baird (@KNXBaird) [#beaches]for the next couple of days. This is the view from the pier in [#HermosaBeach]. [@knxnews] [pic.twitter.com/cLgKuXdUZv] [December 28, 2023] ‚ÄúAs those (swells) come to the coast and they break, that‚Äôs when you get those large waves at the coastlines and at the beaches,‚Äù said [Alexis Clouser](https://www.washingtonpost.com/weather/2023/12/28/big-waves-california-storms-surf/), a weather service meteorologist. ‚ÄúThese are not the highest wave heights we‚Äôve seen, but they‚Äôre certainly on the larger side."

title: 'Leisure Suit Larry' Is Getting Delisted on Steam, and It's Not Because of the Woke Mind Virus - And It Might Be EA's Fault | Flipboard
text:
‚ÄòLeisure Suit Larry‚Äô Is Getting Delisted on Steam, and It‚Äôs Not Because of the Woke Mind Virus - And It Might Be EA‚Äôs Fault Regardless of the type of game, it‚Äôs never good to see a classic series get removed from digital storefronts. While people crave nostalgia, it seems that Leisure Suit Larry fans are going to need to move quickly. Especially if they want to get their hands full (heh) of games. While Larry has had ‚Ä¶

title: Reprocha Bernardo Segura a AMLO: ‚Äúen su momento la historia lo va a juzgar‚Äù
text:
Leer todo el art√≠culo Newsweek Reprocha Bernardo Segura a AMLO: ‚Äúen su momento la historia lo va a juzgar‚Äù Redacci√≥n 7 de junio de 2024, 12:19 a. m. ¬∑ 1 min de lectura Enlace copiado
El Foro ‚ÄúJuventud y Deporte en el Proyecto de Claudia Sheinbaum‚Äù que se llev√≥ a cabo el jueves 23 de mayo en el Club de Periodistas de la Ciudad de M√©xico, el medallista ol√≠mpico Bernardo Segura le reproch√≥ a AMLO que no llevara a cabo el Proyecto Deportivo Nacional que elabor√≥:
‚ÄúHace 6 a√±os, y aqu√≠ hay muchos que no me van a dejar mentir, veo a bastantes, me apoyaron porque el entonces Candidato a la Presidencia, el Lic. Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador me pidi√≥ coordinar los esfuerzos del tema del deporte, as√≠ mismo como el Licenciado Esteban Moctezuma. Desafortunadamente, digo desafortunadamente, los esfuerzos que hicimos, de coordinaci√≥n, de apoyo de todos ustedes, pues muchos participaron en esos foros, se incluyeron en un documento que desafortunadamente, no se llev√≥ a cabo en este sexenio, motivos habr√°, se sabr√°n, en su momento la historia lo va a juzgar‚Äù.
‚ÄúCuando yo me enter√© que Marijose iba a llegar al Comit√© Ol√≠mpico Mexicano y Ana Guevara a la CONADE dije bueno pues mujeres, yo creo que se van a identificar bien y vamos a sacar adelante nuestro deporte mexicano. Es mejor que en nuestro deporte se hable de los triunfos, de los resultados, de lo que hemos hecho, de lo que se ha logrado, m√°s que se hable de temas extra deportivos, eso si es muy lamentable, creo que eso ya no va a pasar‚Äù.
El cargo Reprocha Bernardo Segura a AMLO: ‚Äúen su momento la historia lo va a juzgar‚Äù apareci√≥ primero en Newsweek en Espa√±ol .

author: Press Trust of India
title: 47% Gen Z Professionals Plan To Leave Their Jobs Within 2 Years: Survey
text: The report underscored Gen Z's ambition and desire for growth. Forty-seven per cent Gen Z professionals plan to leave their jobs within two years, while as many prioritise work-life balance when evaluating potential employers, according to a survey. The report, titled "Gen Z at workplace", is based on a survey of over 5,350 Gen Z and 500 HR professionals, conducted by Unstop -- a talent engagement and hiring platform for students and graduates. The report highlighted a significant concern among Gen Z professionals, with 51 per cent expressing fear of job loss at present. This anxiety extends to their career prospects, as 40 per cent worry about securing positions in their preferred fields upon entering the job market. "Despite these reservations, Gen Z demonstrates a clear set of priorities when it comes to their careers. 77 pc of the respondents prioritise the role or brand over commercials, with 43 pc specifically seeking hands-on experience and growth opportunities. This focus on professional development is further emphasised by the fact that 72 pc of Gen Zs consider job satisfaction more important than salary," the report said. The study also revealed a disconnect between Gen Z's motivations and HR perceptions. "While 78 pc of Gen Zs switch jobs for career growth, 71 pc of HR professionals assume it is primarily for better pay. In reality, only 25 pc of Gen Zs prioritise money as their main motivation while switching jobs. "Work-life balance is one of the crucial factors to consider in any job for Gen Zs, with 47 pc of them citing this as a key element when evaluating potential employers. Their ideal workday involves completing routine tasks efficiently, leaving room for skill-building and productivity without feeling overwhelmed," it said. The report underscored Gen Z's ambition and desire for growth. Their top priority is a solid career path with room for promotions, accompanied by a vibrant, supportive culture. "While 44 pc of recruiters believe Gen Z values company culture more than career progression, the reality is more nuanced. Gen Z seeks a balance of both, with a strong emphasis on opportunities for personal and professional development," it said. The report also delved into other aspects, such as Gen Z's top reasons for switching jobs, top concerns while entering the job market, their expectations with respect to mental health, and their varied working style that shifts from the one-size-fits-all approach. "For the youngest generation in the workforce, work isn't just a place you go to every day to get your account credited regularly. It has to fit into several key aspects of your life seamlessly," Ankit Aggarwal, Founder and CEO of Unstop, said. Promoted Listen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com "They (Gen Z) are reminding us that work should be a part of life, and not the other way around... It's a call to action for employers and recruiters. Those employers who adapt to these fast-changing expectations will be preferred by the new generation of employees," he added. (Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)

author: Manon de Meersman
title: On conna√Æt l‚Äôune des raisons du divorce de Jennifer Lopez et Ben Affleck
text:
On l‚Äôapprenait r√©cemment : entre Jennifer Lopez et Ben Affleck, rien ne va plus, √† tel point que cette premi√®re a officiellement demand√© le divorce.
Des ann√©es apr√®s leur premi√®re tentative de mariage, Jennifer Lopez et Ben Affleck avaient d√©cid√© de se donner une nouvelle chance. En vain, puisque deux ans apr√®s s‚Äô√™tre dit ¬´ oui ¬ª, le couple se s√©pare, et on conna√Æt aujourd‚Äôhui l‚Äôune des raisons qui a pouss√© JLo √† demander le divorce.
Lire aussi:
Qui de Ben Affleck ou Jennifer Lopez risque d‚Äôy perdre le plus lors du divorce?
Un sentiment d‚Äôimpuissance
Et la faute reviendrait √† Ben Affleck. Selon des sources proches des stars, Jennifer Lopez en aurait eu marre de devoir s‚Äôoccuper de son ch√©ri. ‚ÄúElle passait beaucoup de son temps √† s‚Äôassurer que Ben √©tait heureux et qu‚Äôil avait tout ce dont il avait besoin‚Äù, a ainsi confi√© un ami de la chanteuse.
La fa√ßon dont elle s‚Äôoccupait de lui √©tait presque enfantine. Ses amis lui rappelaient constamment qu‚Äôelle n‚Äô√©tait pas responsable de ses √©motions.
, a-t-il ajout√©. Un comble pour Jennifer Lopez, qui avait tout de m√™me sorti un titre intitul√© ‚ÄúI ain‚Äôt your mama‚Äù (‚Äùje ne suis pas ta m√®re‚Äù en fran√ßais). De plus, la star aurait eu du mal √† g√©rer le caract√®re lunatique de Ben Affleck, dont l‚Äôhumeur pouvait changer d‚Äôune seconde √† l‚Äôautre. ‚ÄúIl ne pouvait pas se cacher, m√™me s‚Äôil essayait de le faire‚Äù a confi√© une source proche du couple, en parlant du comportement de l‚Äôacteur.
Sur les derni√®res ann√©es √©coul√©es, Jennifer Lopez a encha√Æn√© les projets. Forc√©ment, son besoin de souffler √©tait essentiel, mais il n‚Äôa malheureusement pas pu √™tre combl√© comme elle l‚Äôaurait souhait√©, justement en raison du comportement de son (ex)ch√©ri. ‚ÄúQuand les sautes d‚Äôhumeur, les hauts et les bas cr√©ent une toxicit√© omnipr√©sente, personne ne peut vous aider ‚Äî vous devez vous aider vous-m√™me, a ajout√© la source. Bien s√ªr qu‚Äôil y avait de l‚Äôamour, tout le monde les adorait mais celui qu‚Äôil pr√©tendait √™tre et celui qu‚Äôil est devenu √©taient deux personnes diff√©rentes.‚Äù

Vous avez rep√©r√© une erreur ou disposez de plus d‚Äôinfos?
